alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 6:09PM EDT until July 01 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Buckingham. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Gold Mine Branch, Brick Kiln Branch, James River, Alabama Creek, Iron Branch, Crooked Creek, Horsepen Creek, David Creek, Forsip Creek, Cooper Creek, Grease Creek, Dolittle Creek and Frisby Branch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buckingham... Wingina... Toga... Centenary... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
